characters.name: Abaddon the Despoiler
characters.description: The name of Abaddon, Warmaster of Chaos, favoured champion of all Chaos gods, has become a bitter curse for the Imperium. It is said that he alone has the power to unite the Traitor Legions and finish the treachery begun ten thousand years ago.

activeAbility.name: Drach’nyen
activeAbility.description: Abaddon is set to [hp] Health and immediately performs a normal melee attack against an adjacent enemy. After this attack and for the rest of the battle, after performing a normal melee attack, Abaddon performs a second attack against an adjacent enemy, dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage.

passiveAbility.name: First Among Traitors
passiveAbility.description: Other friendly Chaos units within [range] hexes deal +[extraDmg] Damage. This value is increased by +[extraDmg_2] Damage for each attack Abaddon has performed in this battle, up to a maximum of +[maxDmg] Damage after 13 attacks.

characters.name: Adamatar Xandassus, Mirrorborn
characters.description: Lords Kakophonist are infernal conductors leading an orchestra of discordant and deafening slaughter. Such is their singular obsession with emitting lethal sonic destruction that their bodies have been agonisingly sculpted to further their art.

activeAbility.name: Doom Siren
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage to an adjacent enemy and up to [nrOfUnits] other random enemies adjacent to the target. For the rest of the battle, Adamatar's normal attacks score an additional hit for each enemy Overkilled by Doom Siren.

passiveAbility.name: Obsessive Annunciation
passiveAbility.description: All enemy units adjacent to Adamatar take +[extraDmg] Damage from ranged attacks. If an enemy was Overkilled this turn, enemies adjacent to Adamatar take +[extraCritDmg] Crit Damage from all attacks by friendly Chaos units.

characters.name: Aesoth Koumadra
characters.description: Vexilus Praetors are veteran Custodians who have the incomparable privilege of bearing one of the Custodes’ prized vexillas into battle. These inspirational, artisan-crafted banners bear arcane technologies and radiate with the Emperor’s own light.

activeAbility.name: Vexilla Magnifica
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Physical Damage to an adjacent enemy target and an additional adjacent enemy unit. Both enemies are Stunned for 1 round, and Aesoth receives -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage for [nrOfRounds] round. This ability can be used multiple times per battle but has a cooldown of [cooldownTurns] rounds.

passiveAbility.name: Stand Vigil
passiveAbility.description: Friendly surrounding units have +[extraArmor] Armour and deal +[extraDmgPct]% Damage with attacks that are not normal attacks. If a friendly Adeptus Custodes uses an Active Ability, Stand Vigil affects all other friendly units within [range] hexes for 1 round.

characters.name: Aethana Barantharal
characters.description: Autarchs are renowned for their strategic brilliance, sublime martial skill and indomitable strength of will. Wielding tactics mastered across millennia of battle, they apply all that they have learned to their command of the Asuryani war hosts.

activeAbility.name: Swooping Hawk
activeAbility.description: Flies over and deals a wave of damage from an initial melee target to targets up to 2 hexes behind. [nrOfHits]x [dmg[0 Piercing Damage to first target, [nrOfHits]x [dmg[1 Piercing Damage to the second, and [nrOfHits]x [dmg[2 Piercing Damage to the third. Lands in the hex directly behind the last target hit, or - in case that hex is occupied - to the closest free hex to it. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Path Of Command
passiveAbility.description: Other friendly units within [range] hexes gain +[extraDmg] Damage. Their Crit chance – if they have one – is increased by +[extraCritChance]%. Affected Aeldari units gain an additional +[extraDmg_2] Damage.

characters.name: Ahzek Ahriman
characters.description: For ten thousand years, the seeker of truth known as Ahriman has roamed the galaxy in a quest to acquire every artefact, tome and scroll that harbours eldritch knowledge. Worlds burn in his shadow as he plucks these treasures by any means necessary.

activeAbility.name: Doombolt
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage, evenly distributing the hits between all enemies within [range] hexes. Adds +1 hit for each hex on the battlefield that is currently on Fire. Cannot exceed 9 hits. When Ahriman defeats an enemy with his normal ranged attack and Doombolt has already been used, then Doombolt can be used again in this battle.

passiveAbility.name: Psychic Stalk
passiveAbility.description:
Attacks that deal Flame Damage and Psychic Damage to enemies that are on hexes with Fire deal +[extraDmgPct]% Damage. Affected attacks from friendly Chaos units deal an additional +[extraDmg] Damage.

The hex of each enemy that is hit by Ahriman's normal ranged attack catches Fire.

characters.name: Ancient Cantus Thoread
characters.description: Ancients bear the honour of carrying their Chapter’s precious standards into battle, which incorporate the remains of fallen heroes. In their presence, battle-brothers are inspired to emulate the legendary deeds of these paragons of old.

activeAbility.name: Unbreakable Duty
activeAbility.description: Ancient Thoread and all friendly units within [range] hexes receive -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage until the start of their next turn. If 2 or more friendly Imperial Characters are dead upon activation of this ability, Ancient Thoread gains [extraHp] extra Health and +[extraDmg] Damage until the end of the battle and immediately performs a normal attack against an adjacent enemy.

passiveAbility.name: Astartes Banner
passiveAbility.description: Other friendly units within [range] hexes score an additional hit with their melee attacks. This additional hit can deal a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage.

characters.name: Apothecary Incisus
characters.description: Amongst the most honoured Space Marines of a Chapter are its Apothecaries. It is their role to mind the physical well-being of their battle-brothers. On the battlefield, they serve as medics.

activeAbility.name: Combat Restoratives
activeAbility.description: Heals himself and all adjacent friendly units for [hpToHeal] Health. [hpToHeal_2] Health if Imperial.

passiveAbility.name: Narthecium
passiveAbility.description: When an adjacent friendly non-Mechanical unit is defeated, it is immediately revived with [hp] Health, unless Overkilled. Can only be triggered once per turn.

characters.name: Arjac Rockfist
characters.description: A former Iron Priest of the forge, Arjac is a towering mass of muscle and a taciturn anvil of endurance, who upholds the honour of the Chapter. Wielding the enormous Foehammer, Arjac crushes his enemies with pulverising strength.

activeAbility.name: Foehammer
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to an enemy within range [range] and the target is Stunned until the beginning of Arjac's next turn. For each Character that has been defeated in this battle, this ability deals +[extraDmg] Damage.

passiveAbility.name: Anvil Shield
passiveAbility.description: Arjac blocks an additional [blockDmg] Damage and when he Blocks he covers the attacker's hex in Ice. If Arjac is below [healthPct]% Health, or if his attacker is on a hex covered in Ice, he gains +[blockChance]% Block chance and if he blocks a melee attack, the attacker is Stunned until the end of the attacker's next turn.

characters.name: Arkarzar Abraxas
characters.description: Infernal Masters forge pacts with daemonic entities, called tutelaries. They can unleash the powers of these malign familiars to engulf their foes in swarms of momentarily corporeal terrors or to master the currents of the empyrean itself.

activeAbility.name: Malefic Maelstrom
activeAbility.description:
Summon a Pink Horror on a free hex adjacent to Abraxas. Until the end of this turn, whenever an enemy unit is dealt Psychic Damage, summon a Screamer of Tzeentch on a free hex adjacent to Abraxas, preferring hexes adjacent to enemy units. Newly summoned units can immediately attack an enemy in range but cannot move.

Pink Horror stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage

Screamer of Tzeentch stats:
[summonHp_2] Health
[summonDmg_2] Damage

passiveAbility.name: Infernal Pacts
passiveAbility.description: Friendly Chaos units adjacent to Abraxas deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage with their normal ranged attacks. Affected Daemons also gain the bonus hit on their normal melee attack.

characters.name: Asmodai
characters.description: Asmodai is the Dark Angels’ most successful Interrogator-Chaplain. Relentless and humourless, in battle he incites his brothers’ fighting spirit to reach new heights, rendering them unstoppable killing machines by chanting his litanies of hate with unshakeable belief.

activeAbility.name: Exemplar of Hate
activeAbility.description: Targets an enemy on the battlefield. For this round and the next, all friendly units deal +[extraDmg] Damage against that enemy with melee or Overwatch attacks. If that enemy is Chaos, it gets Suppressed and Asmodai or another friendly Dark Angel immediately performs a normal attack against the target, dealing [dmgPct]% of its own damage, to a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage per hit.

passiveAbility.name: Feared Interrogator
passiveAbility.description: Deals +[extraDmg] Damage against enemies that are Suppressed, Stunned, or that are adjacent to another friendly Dark Angel. Scores [extraHits] additional hits if the enemy is also Chaos.

characters.name: Atlacoya
characters.description: Atlacoya took her vow of silence upon joining the Sisters of Silence. She is stationed aboard a Black Ship, tasked with collecting a cargo of psykers for the Imperial Tithe - most to be sacrificed to the Golden Throne, a fact that she accepts as a necessity for the continuation of the Imperium.

activeAbility.name: Talons Of The Emperor
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to an adjacent enemy unit. This attack deals +[extraDmg] Damage for each time a friendly Character has used an active ability this battle. If the target is a Psyker or Atlacoya is adjacent to a friendly Adeptus Custodes, this attack deals Direct Damage instead.

passiveAbility.name: Daughter Of The Abyss
passiveAbility.description: Atlacoya takes -[dmgReduction] Psychic Damage. Psychic Damage dealt to other friendly units within [range] hexes of Atlacoya is reduced by [dmgReductionPct]%. Enemy Psykers within [range] hexes receive +[extraDmgPct]% Damage.

characters.name: Aun'Shi
characters.description: Aun'Shi is a hero to his people, a humble warrior whose presence inspires the T'au warriors around him. Marrying the uplifting nature of his Ethereal caste with exceptional martial skill, Aun'Shi is a blazing beacon lighting the path to victory.

activeAbility.name: Inspired to Greatness
activeAbility.description: Enables a friendly unit in an adjacent hex to use their active ability again in this battle and heals or repairs it for [hpToHeal] Health. For this second use, the ability is at the lowest of its own level and that of Inspired to Greatness. If that unit has not used their active ability yet, then [hpToHeal_2] Health is restored instead.

passiveAbility.name: Serene Unifier
passiveAbility.description:
Aun'Shi grants himself, and adjacent friendly units a bonus based on the current round at the beginning of his turn. Friendly T'au Empire units within [range] hexes also receive this bonus. The bonus lasts until the start of the unit's next turn, even if Aun'Shi is defeated. The following Buffs are granted subsequently in each round:

1: Sense of Stone: units take -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage
2: Zephyr's Grace: units receive +[extraMovement] Movement
3: Storm of Fire: units gain +[extraDmg] Damage

After round 3, the cycle begins again and will continue to repeat until Aun'Shi is defeated.

characters.name: Azkor, the Eightfold
characters.description: Each Eightbound is possessed by an octet of Khornate daemons. Achieving a form of apotheosis, as their mortal soul conquers the daemons that share its body, Exalted Eightbound exhibit a purer and more focused rage – one that is directed entirely at their foes.

activeAbility.name: Overwhelming Wrath
activeAbility.description: Until the beginning of his next turn Azkor Taunts all adjacent enemies and takes -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage from ranged attacks. Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Eviscerating Damage to all adjacent enemies at the beginning of Azkor's next turn.

passiveAbility.name: Beacon Of Rage
passiveAbility.description: For each time he was attacked in battle, up to a maximum of [nrOfAttacks] times, Azkor deals +[extraDmg] Damage. If Azkor has defeated an enemy in this battle, 50% of the extra damage granted by Beacon of Rage is added to the damage of melee attacks of adjacent friendly Chaos units.

characters.name: Azrael
characters.description: As the "Keeper of the Truth", Azrael carries the dark burden of his chapter. As masterful commander, he quickly grasps changing battlefield realities and orchestrates his forces to maximum advantage. As a warrior, he never falters.

activeAbility.name: Dark Talon Strike
activeAbility.description: Azrael calls in a Ravenwing Dark Talon to deal [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage to a target enemy within [range] hexes and [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Bolter Damage to all enemies in an uninterrupted straight line originating from the initial target. All enemies hit are Suppressed. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Lion Helm
passiveAbility.description: Friendly units within [range] hexes block an additional [blockDmg] Damage when they Block and deal +[extraDmg] Damage with attacks triggered by Overwatch. Other friendly Dark Angels within [range] hexes also have their Block chance increased by +[blockChance]%

characters.name: Baraqiel
characters.description: Deploying rapidly onto the battlefield via blazing teleport strikes, Deathwing Terminators pour heavy fire into their enemies or engage them in brutal melee. They are the unbreakable elite of the Dark Angels that can conquer and hold any key position.

activeAbility.name: Plasma Cannon
activeAbility.description:
Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Plasma Damage to an enemy within range [range] and up to two enemy units behind the target. This ability can be used multiple times per battle but has a cooldown of [cooldownTurns] round. 

Initial cooldown: [initialCooldownTurns] round.

passiveAbility.name: Deathwing
passiveAbility.description: Each time Baraqiel blocks damage during an attack, all further incoming damage is reduced by [dmgReduction] and the damage Baraqiel deals with melee or Plasma Cannon attacks is increased by [extraDmg] for 1 round. This effect is doubled against Chaos enemies or when standing adjacent to another friendly Dark Angel.

characters.name: Battle Sister Vindicta
characters.description: Celestians are the finest and noblest warriors of their Order, inspirational figures who punish the faithless with relentless barrages of bolter fire and gouts of sacred flame.

activeAbility.name: Armorium Cherub
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Flame Damage to a target within range [range]. Using Armorium Cherub does not end Vindicta's turn.

passiveAbility.name: Fire of Absolution
passiveAbility.description: When performing a ranged attack, also deals [nrOfHits]x [dmg] Flame Damage to all units adjacent to the target. Has a [chance]% chance of setting each adjacent hex on Fire as well.

characters.name: Brother Kenric Jaeger
characters.description: On the eve of battle, one among the Black Templars will receive a vision from the Emperor. The Chaplains will bless him and adorn him with the finest weapons, for he will seek out and strike down the enemy leaders as the Emperor’s Champion.

activeAbility.name: Holy Duel
activeAbility.description: Brother Jaeger Taunts an adjacent enemy unit and immediately performs a normal attack against it. Brother Jaeger deals +[extraDmg] Damage and takes -[dmgReduction] Damage from the target while it’s Taunted by him. Brother Jaeger is also Taunted by the target and the taunt does not expire with rounds passed.

passiveAbility.name: Martial Superiority
passiveAbility.description: If Brother Jaeger gets targeted with a melee attack from an adjacent enemy during the enemy’s turn, he deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to the attacker before the enemy attack executes.

characters.name: Brother Raimund Burchard
characters.description: Capable of spearheading devastating offences, Aggressors are walking ceramite strong-points. They excel at close-quarters combat and laying down torrents of withering fire before crushing their foes with their energised fists.

activeAbility.name: Fragstorm Grenade Launcher
activeAbility.description: Deals up to [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage to a target within [range] hexes. Any leftover hits are allocated to enemy units within [range] hexes, prioritising kills.

passiveAbility.name: Boltstorm
passiveAbility.description: Normal ranged attacks deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Bolter Damage to the target and to each enemy adjacent to the target that is also within range of Brother Burchard. Enemies hit are Suppressed for 1 round.

characters.name: Calandis Tawaren
characters.description: Rangers are outcast wanderers who left the regimented lives of the craftworlds behind them. Adepts in the arts of stealth warfare, marksmanship, and tracking enemies through harsh terrain, the Rangers aid their brethren as scouts and snipers.

activeAbility.name: Fire And Reposition
activeAbility.description: May move as normal and attack. After attacking, she may make one more normal movement. In the following enemy turn, she takes -[dmgReduction] Damage from ranged attacks. Can only be used if Calandis has a target in range.

passiveAbility.name: Wireweave Net
passiveAbility.description: The first time Calandis is targeted by a normal melee attack during the enemy's turn, the attacker immediately takes [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage. If the attacker is eliminated, their melee attack is not executed.

characters.name: Canoptek Spyder Aleph-Null
characters.description: Canoptek Spyders never sleep, but while away the aeons servicing the structures of their Tomb World. The Canoptek Spyder is essentially an automated drone, but still a formidable foe when the situation demands.

activeAbility.name: Scarab Hive
activeAbility.description:
Summons 2 Scarab Swarms next to the target, whom they immediately attack using the Damage type Piercing. In any subsequent attack they use their normal damage type.

Scarab Swarm’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Fabricator Claw Array
passiveAbility.description:
After moving, repairs one random adjacent friendly Mechanical unit for [hpToRepair] Health.
If Aleph-Null does not move, then this ability triggers at the end of its turn.

characters.name: Celestine, the living Saint
characters.description: Saint Celestine is a living embodiment of the Emperor’s might, and she radiates holy light. Beneath her, the faithful are filled with courage, while heretics experience overwhelming terror.

activeAbility.name: Sky Strike
activeAbility.description:
If Celestine has not moved, she targets an enemy unit on the battlefield that has a free adjacent hex, then moves adjacent to it and attacks it. The attack deals the same damage as her normal attack plus an additional  +[extraDmg] Damage.

Initial cooldown: [initialCooldownTurns] round.

passiveAbility.name: Geminae Superia
passiveAbility.description:
When attacked, summons a Geminae Superia in a free adjacent hex, and immediately triggers its passive ability Lifewards. Can do this twice per battle.

Geminae Superia’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Commander Dante
characters.description: Commander Dante is the Bringer of Sanguinius’ Light and the Living Embodiment of the Five Angelic Graces. He is among the oldest living Space Marines and is the longest serving Chapter Master. To describe him as a legend is an understatement bordering on insult.

activeAbility.name: Light of Sanguinius
activeAbility.description: If Dante has not moved, he gains Infiltrate until the end of this turn, then charges an enemy target that has a free adjacent hex within movement range [range] and deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Melta Damage to it. The target and enemy units surrounding it deal -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage for [nrOfRounds] round. This effect is doubled if they attack friendly units that are at or below [healthPct]% Health.

passiveAbility.name: Lord of the Host
passiveAbility.description: Other friendly units within [range] hexes with Rapid Assault or Flying deal +[extraDmg] Damage with melee attacks. Affected units that are at or below [healthPct]% Health also score an additional hit with melee attacks.

characters.name: Commissar Sebastian Yarrick
characters.description: At Hades Hive, Commissar Yarrick lost his right arm to the snapping battle klaw of an Ork Warboss. Fighting through pain and shock, Yarrick beheaded the Warboss and took that same klaw as his own.

activeAbility.name: Send In The Next Wave
activeAbility.description:
Select a target within 2 hexes. Summon [nrOfSummons] Cadian Guardsmen plus one for each defeated friendly unit, who immediately appear and fire upon a target from random free hexes within range 2 of the target. The maximum number of Cadian Guardsmen this can summon is [maxSummons]. 

Cadian Guardsman’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Summary Execution
passiveAbility.description: Friendly units with Battle Fatigue gain +[extraDmg] Damage. The first time a friendly unit would flee due to Battle Fatigue, it is executed instead and all other friendly units with the trait ignore it and gain an additional +[extraDmg_2] Damage.

characters.name: Corrodius Achebile
characters.description: Cursed plague bells tolling, Noxious Blightbringers erode the enemy’s will to fight and spawn maggots in the minds of psykers. To the Death Guard the sound is beautiful, and upon hearing it they surge eagerly into the fray.

activeAbility.name: Poxwalkers
activeAbility.description:
Summons Poxwalkers in [chance]-[chance_2]% of free hexes (rounded up) within Corrodius' Contagion aura. Newly summoned Poxwalkers immediately attack in melee, but cannot move this turn.

Poxwalker’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage

passiveAbility.name: Cursed Plague Bell
passiveAbility.description: Friendly Chaos units starting their turn within Corrodius' Contagion aura gain +[extraMovement] Movement for this turn. Enemy Psyker units within Corrodius' Contagion aura deal [nrOfHits]x [dmg] Psychic Damage to themselves each time one of their attacks deals Psychic Damage.

characters.name: Deathleaper
characters.description: The Hive Mind created this advancement of the Lictor strain as a terror weapon. Possessing an instinctive understanding of how to spread fear, it uses its skills in stealth, infiltration and assassination to sow paranoia and dread before the hive fleet attacks en masse.

activeAbility.name: Fear of the Unseen
activeAbility.description: If the Deathleaper has not moved this turn and is not in Deep Strike, all enemies within [range] hexes get Suppressed and trigger Battle Fatigue, if they have it. The Deathleaper vanishes and cannot be targeted or damaged for 1 round. In its next turn, its attacks deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage and it can move to any free hex on the battlefield that is either within Synapse range, has Tall Grass or is not adjacent to an enemy.

passiveAbility.name: Feeder Tendrils
passiveAbility.description: When charging, the Deathleaper deals +[extraDmg] Damage, heals for [hpToHeal] Health and Suppresses the target for 1 round.

characters.name: Demetrian Titus
characters.description: Amongst the ranks of the Ultramarines, Lieutenant Titus has a reputation for decisive action and incredible warrior skill. He has fought countless battles in the Emperor’s name and always emerged victorious despite seemingly impossible odds.

activeAbility.name: Tactical Precision
activeAbility.description: Attacks a targeted adjacent enemy. If Titus has charged that enemy this turn, he deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Bolter Damage to it. This attack is always a Crit and deals an additional +[extraCritDmg] Crit Damage. If Titus did not charge the targeted enemy this turn, he instead deals [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Chain Damage to all adjacent enemies. When Titus gets revived or resurrected and Tactical Precision has already been used, then Tactical Precision can be used again in this battle.

passiveAbility.name: Fuelled by Fury
passiveAbility.description: Deals +[extraDmg] Damage with all attacks for each time a friendly Character has used an active ability this battle. The first time each turn that Titus is defeated he cannot be Overkilled. The first time each turn he defeats an enemy with an attack triggered by Final Vengeance he is immediately revived with [hp] Health.

characters.name: Drakfus Angrax
characters.description: This Champion of Chaos has dedicated his life to further the cause of Chaos. An extremely powerful warrior, wearing an indomitable suit of Terminator armour most likely acquired through killing the previous owner.

activeAbility.name: Bringer of Despair
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to a melee target and [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to another random enemy adjacent to Angrax. Any resulting Battle Fatigue is triggered twice.

passiveAbility.name: Hateful Assault
passiveAbility.description: Attacks any enemy that moves from a hex adjacent to him, dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage.

characters.name: Eldryon Ynaduin
characters.description: Psykers of unparalleled ability and renown, the Farseers meticulously plan and execute strategies covering thousands of years. Even their smallest actions can bring enormous change; they are the butterfly's wings and the hurricane in one.

activeAbility.name: Executioner
activeAbility.description: An enemy target within range [range] takes [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage for each round that has started. If the target is eliminated, then an adjacent enemy unit also takes [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage for each round that has started.

passiveAbility.name: Doom
passiveAbility.description: All enemy units exactly [range] hexes away from Eldryon take +[extraDmg] Damage from other friendly unit's normal attacks. Other friendly Aeldari units deal +[extraDmg_2] Damage with all their attacks to affected units instead.

characters.name: Exitor-Rho-1.15/x
characters.description: Ruststalkers are unleashed to hunt down errant servo units and heretic blasphemers, or to pounce on isolated hostile units and assassinate enemy leaders. Their stilt-like limbs enable them to run down their prey before carving them apart with transonic blades.

activeAbility.name: Chordclaw
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage to an adjacent enemy. All of Exitor-Rho’s further attacks until the end of its next turn deal an additional [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Direct Damage.

passiveAbility.name: Optimised Gait
passiveAbility.description: Whenever an enemy adjacent to Exitor-Rho is attacked by another friendly Mechanical unit, Exitor-Rho deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Energy Damage to that enemy. If an enemy adjacent to Exitor-Rho is defeated by a friendly Mechanical unit or an attack triggered from this ability, Exitor-Rho moves onto its hex.

characters.name: Forcas Oathsworn
characters.description: Wielding Calibanite greatswords with breathtaking skill, Inner Circle Companions are sinister warriors whether battling as allies or enemies. They fight in silence, save for the whine of their armour servos and the crunch of their blades through flesh and bone.

activeAbility.name: Calibanite Greatsword
activeAbility.description: Forcas can switch between two stances. Strike Stance: At the end of his turn, Forcas starts Overwatching, even if he attacked in his turn. When defeating a unit while Overwatching, he remains in Overwatch, retaining [nrOfHits] fewer hits compared to the previous attack. Sweep Stance: Forcas' normal attacks also deal [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to each enemy adjacent to both Forcas and the initial target. This ability can be used once per turn; each use switches the active Stance and does not end Forcas' turn. Only the first use of this ability in each battle counts for missions.

passiveAbility.name: Enmity for the Unworthy
passiveAbility.description: Forcas deals +[extraDmgPct]% Damage for each adjacent unit and additionally +[extraDmg] Damage for each adjacent friendly Dark Angel.

characters.name: Gibbascrapz, da Spezulist
characters.description: Projected from a mass of whirly bits and alarmingly-sparking gubbinz, the kustom force field is a wobbling energy dome, leaving the Mek and his oblivious mates protected from incoming fire and free to storm onward into battle.

activeAbility.name: Grot Tank
activeAbility.description:
Calls in a Grot Tank in an adjacent free hex. The Grot Tank cannot move in its first turn, but can immediately attack an enemy in range.

Grot Tank’s stats:
[summonHp] Health +[extraHp] for each round that has started
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Kustom Force Field
passiveAbility.description: All friendly adjacent units have an additional +[extraArmor] Armour.

characters.name: Grumbal Snotflogga
characters.description: It takes an Ork of infinite patience – by Ork standards – and a gimlet glare to wrangle a war band’s grots and snots. Of course, a savage squig hound with which to make a few examples doesn’t hurt either.

activeAbility.name: Get ’Em Runtz
activeAbility.description:
Summons 1 Grot in each adjacent hex that also has an enemy unit adjacent to it. Newly spawned Grots can immediately attack an enemy in melee, but cannot move this turn. Enemy units attacked by a Grot this way are Taunted for 1 round.

Grot’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage

passiveAbility.name: Squig Hound
passiveAbility.description:
Friendly Grots ignore Battle Fatigue. Snotflogga's normal attacks deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Physical Damage. After attacking, if there are less than [maxSummons] friendly Grots on the battlefield, they summon a Grot adjacent to the target that immediately can attack.

Grot’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage

characters.name: Gulgortz Bulldoza
characters.description: A towering slab of muscle, metal and bad attitude, a Warboss who leads the charge from the very front, bulldozing a bloody path through the enemy. Meanwhile, his window-rattling war cry motivates his ladz to ever more gratuitous violence.

activeAbility.name: Waaagh!
activeAbility.description:
If Boss Gulgortz has not moved, he summons [nrOfSummons] Ork Boyz in free adjacent hexes. Until the end of this turn, all friendly Orks and friendly units adjacent to Boss Gulgortz gain +[extraMovement] Movement and their normal melee attacks deal +[extraDmg] Damage and score an additional hit. Boss Gulgortz then charges a targeted enemy in movement range, performing a normal melee attack against it. All friendly Ork Boyz take a turn.

Ork Boyz' stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Light ’im up!
passiveAbility.description: After performing a normal attack, Boss Gulgortz performs a second attack against the same enemy, dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Projectile Damage. If the target is defeated, leftover hits are allocated to any random enemy target within [range] hexes.

characters.name: Haarken Worldclaimer
characters.description: Before every doom, there is a portent, before every apocalypse a sign. Haarken Worldclaimer is that dark omen given form, and the otherworldly destruction he heralds is the coming of the Warmaster himself.

activeAbility.name: Herald of the Apocalypse
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage to an adjacent enemy and an additional enemy directly behind the target. Affected enemies receive +[extraDmg] Damage from the next attack made by a unit against them. Also triggers Battle Fatigue for all enemy units within [range] hexes of the original target.

passiveAbility.name: Head-Claimer
passiveAbility.description:
For each enemy unit that Haarken has defeated, his attacks deal +[extraDmg] Damage for the rest of the battle.
For each enemy Character that he has defeated, his attacks also score +[extraHit] hit for the rest of the battle.

characters.name: Hascule Thorn of the Silken Blade
characters.description: These cruel and arrogant warriors are consumed by pride in their own skill at arms. Granted power by daemonic patrons, the Flawless Blades strive to entertain their malefic masters with superlative swordplay and by inflicting vile and visceral death upon their foes.

activeAbility.name: Daemonic Patrons
activeAbility.description: Taunts an adjacent enemy, and Hascule gets watched until the end of his next turn. While being watched, Hascule deals +[extraDmg] Damage and takes -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage for each adjacent Taunted enemy. If he defeats an adjacent Taunted enemy while being watched, he can use this ability again. If he does not, he loses [hpPct]% of his current Health.

passiveAbility.name: Ecstatic Slaughter
passiveAbility.description: When Hascule becomes Thrilled or every time an enemy unit adjacent to him is Overkilled, Hascule deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Eviscerating Damage to an adjacent enemy unit. If the enemy survives, it is Taunted for [nrOfRounds] round.

characters.name: Hexmark Destroyer Imospekh
characters.description: Lethal ambush predators, Hexmark Destroyers unleash inescapable hails of enmitic fire. Independent ocular targeting and optimised firing patterns leave their prey with no escape.

activeAbility.name: Multi-Threat Eliminator
activeAbility.description: Deals 6x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Molecular Damage to an enemy within range [range]. Any leftover hits are allocated to another enemy adjacent to the target and in range [range]. Each enemy killed adds +[extraHit] hit and the ability keeps targeting new enemies until there are no more enemies or hits left.

passiveAbility.name: Inescapable Death
passiveAbility.description:
Imospekh’s ranged attacks each deal +[extraDmg] Damage per hit when triggered by Overwatch.

When defeating a unit with an attack triggered by Overwatch, Imospekh stays in Overwatch, retaining [hitsReduction] fewer hits compared to the previous attack.

characters.name: High Marshal Helbrecht
characters.description: Helbrecht is the living embodiment of his Chapter’s warrior spirit. His battle-brothers follow him without question, for they believe where High Marshal Helbrecht treads, so too walks the Emperor himself.

activeAbility.name: Crusade Of Wrath
activeAbility.description: All friendly units within [range] hexes gain +[extraDmg] Damage and +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio in melee – regardless of Damage type – for this round and the next. High Marshal Helbrecht immediately performs a normal melee attack against a random adjacent enemy.

passiveAbility.name: Destroy The Witch
passiveAbility.description: Gains +[extraMovement] Movement when there’s an enemy Psyker on the battlefield. This unit and friendly adjacent units deal +[extraDmg] Damage with melee attacks against Psykers.

characters.name: Hollan Baumgart
characters.description: A Biophagus is a scientist-surgeon and deadly agent of biological warfare. Their injector goad can be used to enhance the unholy might of Aberrants and other favoured cultists, or to dose enemies with a mutagenic cocktail that rapidly dissolves them from within.

activeAbility.name: Aberrant Hypermorph
activeAbility.description:
Summons an Aberrant Hypermorph in a free adjacent hex. The Aberrant Hypermorph can immediately attack, but cannot move this turn.

Aberrant Hypermorph's stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Twisted Science
passiveAbility.description: Units healed by Hollan, other than himself, are affected by Twisted Science until they are defeated. Hollan can heal other unaffected units even if they are at full Health. Affected units immediately gain [hp] Health and their maximum Health increases by the same amount. If they are a Genestealer Cults unit, they also deal +[extraDmg] Damage while affected. Affected units cannot gain the effects of Twisted Science again.

characters.name: Isaak Starn
characters.description: The Primus is a Genestealer Cult’s ultimate military commander. Besides being deadly combatants in their own right, their mastery of insurgent tactics transforms their followers from a rebellious mob into a lethal military machine.

activeAbility.name: Cult Demagogue
activeAbility.description:
Targets an enemy unit within [range] hexes and places decoys on up to [nrOfSummons] random free hexes within [range_2] hexes around the target. Then summons Neophyte Hybrids on half of all the friendly decoys in that area and all Neophyte Hybrids in that area immediately take a turn.

Neophyte Hybrid stats:
[summonHp_2] Health
[summonDmg_2] Damage
[summonArmor_2] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Decoys and Misdirection
passiveAbility.description: When an enemy moves onto a friendly decoy, it takes [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage. When a friendly unit resurrects onto or moves onto a friendly decoy, it deals +[extraDmg] Damage until the end of its turn, and if it is a Genestealer Cults unit, it also places a new decoy in a free adjacent hex.

characters.name: Isabella Mariken
characters.description: Sisters of the Orders Hospitaller are the physical and spiritual healers of the Adepta Sororitas. As much as their medicinal expertise and surgical skill, they provide a source of faith to those in need.

activeAbility.name: Rites of Restoration
activeAbility.description: Heals herself and all adjacent friendly units for [hpToHeal] Health. Resurrects [nrOfHeroes] random friendly Imperial Character and up to [nrOfSummons] random friendly Imperial Summons that have been defeated in this battle. Resurrected units appear in free adjacent hexes with [hp] Health and are unable to act on this turn. Only affects non-Mechanical units.

passiveAbility.name: Medicus Ministorum
passiveAbility.description: Any friendly adjacent non-mechanical unit that takes Damage regenerates [hpToHeal] Health afterwards, unless it is defeated.

characters.name: Jain Zar
characters.description: To watch Jain Zar in combat is to watch an exquisite dance, amidst leg sweeps, dodging twists and graceful pirouettes, the glowing polearm scythes and darts until only Jain Zar is left standing.

activeAbility.name: Silent Death
activeAbility.description: Jain Zar throws the Silent Death at an adjacent enemy, dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage to it and up to [nrOfTargets] additional enemies adjacent to each other, before returning to Jain Zar’s hands.

passiveAbility.name: Terror's Lament
passiveAbility.description: Adjacent enemy units deal -[dmgReduction] Damage and have -[hitsReduction] hits with melee attacks, to a minimum of 1.

characters.name: Judh Lhaska
characters.description: These gunfighters are living icons of rebellion, moulded to exploit the psyche of fractured Human societies. Whip-fast reactions and hyper-sensory acuity lend the Kelermorph lethal reaction speeds and help them unleash withering volleys from their iconic liberator autostubs.

activeAbility.name: Heroic Fusillade
activeAbility.description: Targets an enemy unit that has a free surrounding hex within movement range [range] of Judh or is already on a hex surrounding Judh. She then moves to the free hex and deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Projectile Damage to the target and all other enemies surrounding it. Crits deal an additional +[extraCritDmg] Crit Damage for each free hex surrounding the targeted enemy. When Judh is resurrected and Heroic Fusillade has already been used, then it can be used again in this battle.

passiveAbility.name: Hypersensory Abilities
passiveAbility.description: The first time each enemy turn that Judh is attacked, she cannot fall below [hpPct]% of her current Health. After the attack, she moves to a free adjacent hex and places a decoy on the hex she moved from. Then, if she is within [range] hexes of the unit that attacked her, she deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Projectile Damage to that unit.

characters.name: Kairatar Thaumachus
characters.description: Twisted arcanists, wicked of intent and strange of form, these warrior-mystics have an encyclopædic knowledge of spells and are able to bend reality to their desires.

activeAbility.name: Attempted Possession
activeAbility.description: Target an enemy within [range] hexes. The target and any Summons it has summoned become possessed and immediately perform a normal attack against the closest enemy unit, preferring unpossessed targets. Possessed units deal [dmgPct]% of their own Damage to a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage per hit. Possessed Summons will move before attacking.

passiveAbility.name: Arcane Shield
passiveAbility.description:
After moving, Thaumachus applies a Shield to the closest friendly unit within [range] hexes, preferring Thousand Sons units, then other Chaos units, then other friendly units, and lastly casting it on himself if there is no other valid target. The shield has [shieldHp] Health and lasts one round.

If Thaumachus does not move, then this ability triggers at the end of his turn.

characters.name: Kariyan Helsates
characters.description: A Blade Champion's role is to identify the greatest battlefield threat and ensure its swift destruction. They are well‐equipped for the task, wielding crackling archeotech blades in a variety of combat styles, each perfect for dealing with a different kind of foe.

activeAbility.name: Martial Inspiration
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Eviscerating Damage to an adjacent enemy. This attack and attacks from Legacy of Combat this turn deal +[extraDmgPct]% Damage for each turn in which Kariyan performed an attack this battle. This ability can be used multiple times per battle but has a cooldown of [cooldownTurns] rounds.

passiveAbility.name: Legacy Of Combat
passiveAbility.description: After performing his first attack each turn, Kariyan performs an additional attack. If he is adjacent to an enemy Big Target, this attack deals [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Piercing Damage to it. If there is no adjacent enemy Big Target, Kariyan deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to each adjacent enemy instead.

characters.name: Khârn the Betrayer
characters.description: Kill! Maim! Burn! This is Khârn’s mantra, and it has become infamous across the Imperium as a harbinger of carnage to follow. Khârn embodies the eightfold path of Khorne; friend and foe alike are left broken, twitching and torn apart in his wake.

activeAbility.name: Kill! Maim! Burn!
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage to an adjacent enemy. Then performs a second attack targeting an adjacent enemy, dealing [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Eviscerating Damage. Then performs a third attack targeting an enemy within range [range], dealing [nrOfHits_3]x [minDmg_3]-[maxDmg_3] Plasma Damage. All attacks prioritize the same target until it is killed and then prioritise kills.

passiveAbility.name: The Betrayer
passiveAbility.description:
After performing a normal attack, Khârn performs a second attack against an adjacent enemy, dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Eviscerating Damage.

If Khârn has defeated an enemy this battle, at the start of his turn, he automatically moves up to [range] hexes towards the nearest unit and then deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Eviscerating Damage to an adjacent unit. Khârn prefers enemies for this automatic move and attack, but targets friendly units if no enemy is in range.

characters.name: Kut Skoden
characters.description: With their overwhelming physicality Ogryns are exceptional shock troops, and are regularly deployed on the front lines of battle. While often not the brightest stars, they take their duties very seriously.

activeAbility.name: Frag Bomb
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage to an adjacent target and [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage to ALL units adjacent to the target hex, except Kut Skoden himself.

passiveAbility.name: Avalanche of Muscle
passiveAbility.description: Deals +[extraDmg] Damage when charging.

characters.name: Laviscus Sentrillion, the Perfect
characters.description: Lords Exultant embody the Emperor's Children's obsessive desire to experience new and terrible sensations. Their enhanced forms possess all manner of sensory enhancements, allowing them to experience the thrill of battle on a level that would drive lesser mortals to insanity.

activeAbility.name: Euphoric Strikes
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to an adjacent enemy. The next attack against that enemy this turn has +[extraCritChance]% Crit Chance. Using Euphoric Strikes does not end Laviscus' turn.

passiveAbility.name: Refusal to be Outdone
passiveAbility.description: Friendly characters attacking enemies adjacent to Laviscus increase his Outrage equal to the highest damage dealt by any of their non-psychic hits this turn. Laviscus' Damage stat is increased by [extraDmgPct]% of his Outrage and his normal attacks deal an additional +[extraCritDmg] Crit Damage for each friendly Chaos character that increased his Outrage this turn. After Laviscus performs a normal attack, his Outrage resets.

characters.name: Lord Castellan Ursarkar E. Creed
characters.description: Blistering assaults, devious traps and impenetrable defences as his trademarks, within three decades the ragged orphan boy Creed had earned acclaim as Cadia’s greatest commander and in Colour Sgt. Kell the most loyal voice to his command.

activeAbility.name: Supreme Commander
activeAbility.description:
Summons up to [nrOfSummons]Cadian Guardsman in free adjacent hexes. All friendly Cadian Guardsmen within [range] hexes then immediately take a turn. If Colour Sergeant Kell is in play, summons an additional Cadian Guardsman and activation range is 3.

Cadian Guardsman’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Sworn Protector
passiveAbility.description:
When Lord Castellan Creed is first targeted in battle, Colour Sergeant Kell appears in a free adjacent hex. Any time Creed is attacked, Kell switches hexes with him and takes the Damage instead, if they are adjacent to each other. 

Kell’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Lord Marshal Varnan Dreir
characters.description: Lord Marshal Dreir leads from the front, despite his lofty rank, and often to the horror of his superiors. That he and his loyal Krieg steed have emerged from so many battles alive and victorious speaks to his skill as both commander and cavalry soldier.

activeAbility.name: Leading the Charge
activeAbility.description:
If Dreir has not moved, he gains Infiltrate until the end of this turn and charges an enemy target that has a free adjacent hex within movement range [range], dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to it. Then, summons up to [nrOfSummons] Death Riders in free adjacent hexes that can immediately attack enemies in range. All attacks triggered by this ability have +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio for each friendly unit that has been defeated this battle. 

Death Rider stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Tough to Kill
passiveAbility.description: At the beginning of his turn, Dreir regenerates [hpToHeal] Health. All attacks against Dreir have -[critChanceReduction]% Crit Chance and deal -[critDmgReduction] Crit Damage.

characters.name: Lucien
characters.description: Members of the Death Company are possessed of a berserk fury, driven insane by terrible visions and hallucinations. Barely flinching at even the most grievous of injuries, they seek nothing but the destruction of their enemies and death in battle.

activeAbility.name: Black Rage
activeAbility.description: If Lucien has not moved, he is set to [hpPct]% Health. He then immediately charges a targeted enemy in movement range and performs a normal melee attack against it. For this attack and until the end of the battle, Lucien has +[extraMovement] Movement and deals +[extraDmg] Damage when charging. Additionally, Lucien can no longer be controlled for the rest of the battle, and moves and attacks automatically at the beginning of his turn instead.

passiveAbility.name: Visions of Heresy
passiveAbility.description: After performing a normal attack, Lucien performs a second attack targeting an enemy within range [range], dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Bolter Damage. If Lucien is at or below [healthPct]% Health, all of his attacks have +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio.

characters.name: Lucius the Eternal
characters.description: An arrogant slaughterer and swordmaster supreme, Lucius seeks out the most skilled enemy champions to find worthy opponents. His curse has seen him return from death many times, each resurrection leaving him more hollow, but compelled to become greater still.

activeAbility.name: Lash of Torment
activeAbility.description: Deals[nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Eviscerating Damage to an enemy unit within range [range]. If the target is not already adjacent to Lucius, it is then pulled 1 hex towards him if possible, and can be pulled over any elevation but not through impassable terrain. If the target is adjacent to Lucius after the attack, it is also Taunted by him for [nrOfRounds] rounds.

passiveAbility.name: Armour of Shrieking Souls
passiveAbility.description: If Lucius is defeated by an enemy unit, that enemy becomes Elated. At the beginning of each of its turns, the affected unit loses [minHp]-[maxHp] Health and when it is defeated, Lucius resurrects on the hex it was defeated on with [hp] Health.

characters.name: Macer Bloodgrin
characters.description: Jakhals are the strongest, most savage, and bloodthirstiest followers of the World Eaters. Though merely human, these elite cultists seek to emulate the frenzied purity of their gore-crazed masters in any way they can, and dive into combat with wild abandon.

activeAbility.name: Jakhal Stimms
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Physical Damage to an adjacent enemy and all other enemies adjacent to both Macer and the target. Then Macer loses [hpPct]% of his current Health. Using Jakhal Stimms does not end Macer's turn.

passiveAbility.name: Skullsmasher
passiveAbility.description: Macer deals +[extraDmg] Damage for each [hpPct]% of his maximum Health he is currently missing. In addition, if Macer has defeated an enemy this battle, all enemies he attacks become Stunned.

characters.name: Magos Dominus Vitruvius Thannek
characters.description: These theocratic generals lead congregations of warriors in binharic prayer and direct those beneath them with precision strategies. They are masters of machines, as capable of healing damage to their creations as they are at destroying the enemy’s corrupted engines.

activeAbility.name: Rad-Bombardment
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Toxic Damage to all units in a straight line in one of 6 directions and adds Contamination to all hexes in the line. All units hit are Suppressed for 1 round. The length of the line starts at 2 hexes and increases by 1 hex for each round that has passed and by 1 hex each time a friendly Mechanic restores Health of a unit. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Master Annihilator
passiveAbility.description: When Vitruvius performs a normal attack against an enemy, that enemy is affected by Master Annihilator until Vitruvius is defeated or performs a normal attack against a different unit. Attacks by any friendly unit against the affected enemy score an additional hit, except attacks that deal Psychic Damage. This additional hit can deal a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage.

characters.name: Maladus Phlegmore
characters.description: Relentless and unstoppably tough, Blightlord Terminators are elite Death Guard warriors who are bound forever to their mutated Armour. They are saturated with foulness, which pours off them to rot flesh and corrode metal.

activeAbility.name: Flail Swing
activeAbility.description: Performs a melee attack dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to the target and triggering Haze of Corruption if the target is defeated. Any unit defeated by this attack or its add-on attacks from Haze of Corruption is always overkilled.

passiveAbility.name: Haze of Corruption
passiveAbility.description: When [UnitName] attacks and defeats a unit, any leftover Damage and an additional [nrOfHits]x [extraDmg] Toxic Damage is dealt to a random enemy adjacent to both [UnitName] and his initial target. If this unit is also defeated, this ability triggers again, dealing Damage to an additional unit adjacent to both [UnitName] and his initial target.

characters.name: Manipulus Actus Fulgorosus
characters.description: Amongst the augmentations of a Tech-Priest Manipulus is a galvanic cell from which they channel powerful charges of the Motive Force. They overcharge their warriors’ armaments, all while defending their divine work with blasts from their own arcane weapons.

activeAbility.name: Defend The Divine Work
activeAbility.description: Repairs himself and all friendly adjacent units [hpToRepair] Health.

passiveAbility.name: Galvanic Field
passiveAbility.description: Whenever Actus repairs another unit, that unit immediately attacks a target in range, dealing [dmgPct]% of its own Damage to a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage per hit. Actus can repair other friendly units even if they are at full Health.

characters.name: Marneus Calgar
characters.description: Marneus Calgar, Chapter Master of the Ultramarines, is not only a consummate warrior, but also a highly talented strategist. He is master of Ultramar, a vast swathe of space on the embattled Eastern Fringe.

activeAbility.name: Gauntlets of Ultramar
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Bolter Damage to all enemies within 2 hexes. Scores an additional hit against surrounding enemies.

passiveAbility.name: Rites of Battle
passiveAbility.description: Adjacent friendly units gain +[extraDmg] Damage. Imperial units gain +[extraDmg_2] Damage instead.

characters.name: Master Archimatos
characters.description: Masters of Possession exert the darkest and most blasphemous lore: The art of using hosts of living flesh to house daemons. So thoroughly are they steeped in desecrating sorcery that where they walk, reality itself recoils.

activeAbility.name: Daemonic Incursion
activeAbility.description:
Summons a Bloodletter adjacent to an enemy target within range [range]. The Bloodletter immediately attacks the target. Keeps summoning Bloodletters up to a max of [maxSummons], as long as the target has not been defeated, is in range and has a free hex adjacent to it. 

Bloodletter’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage

passiveAbility.name: Possession
passiveAbility.description:
Each time Archimatos kills an enemy unit with a melee attack, he summons a Bloodletter in its hex. Each time he kills an enemy unit with a ranged attack, he summons a Blue Horror in its hex.

Bloodletter’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage

Blue Horror's stats:
[summonHp_2] Health
[summonDmg_2] Damage

characters.name: Mataneo
characters.description: Intercessors equipped with powerful jump packs soar over the battlefield, slamming into the foe like a hammer from the skies. They swiftly cut down all opposition with point-blank pistol fire and furious slashes, before launching off to engage the next target.

activeAbility.name: Hammer of Wrath
activeAbility.description: If Mataneo has not moved, he gains Infiltrate until the end of this turn, charges an enemy target that has a free adjacent hex within movement range [range], dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to the target and [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Physical Damage to all enemies adjacent to it. If Mataneo is at or below [healthPct]% Health, doubles the damage dealt by this ability. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Aggressive Onslaught
passiveAbility.description:
When charging, Mataneo summons [nrOfSummons] Jump Pack Intercessors adjacent to and immediately attacking his target. At the beginning of each of Mataneo's turns, if he is still on the battlefield, all Jump Pack Intercessors summoned this way leave the battlefield.

Jump Pack Intercessor stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Maugan Ra
characters.description: Maugan Ra, the Harvester of Souls, is a master at killing from a distance. Maugetar, his scythe-like weapon, fires mind-linked shuriken discs large enough to decapitate swaths of foes and can end even more lives with its built-in reaping blade.

activeAbility.name: Harvester Of Souls
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Heavy Round Damage to a target within range [range] and to all enemies adjacent to the target that are also within range [range] of Maugan Ra. These attacks score an additional hit if Maugan Ra has not moved this turn.

passiveAbility.name: Inescapable Accuracy
passiveAbility.description: If Maugan Ra has not moved, then his ranged attacks ignore hit reductions, have +[extraCritChance]% Crit Chance, and deal an additional [extraCritDmg] Crit Damage. Inescapable Accuracy applies to targets of Harvester of Souls as well as attacks triggered by Overwatch.

characters.name: Mephiston
characters.description: Mephiston is an enormously powerful warrior and psyker. He is the only Blood Angel known to have suppressed the Black Rage, resurrecting from near death with exceptional strength and speed. Many whisper behind his back, asking what price he paid for such a transformation.

activeAbility.name: The Quickening
activeAbility.description: Targets a hex within movement range [range] that is neither occupied by an enemy nor by a friendly unit in Deep Strike. Mephiston moves onto that hex. If a friendly unit is on that hex, that unit moves to Mephiston's previous location. All Blood Angels moving this way perform a normal melee attack after they move, dealing [dmgPct]% of their own damage to a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage. Units moving this way do not trigger Overwatch or other movement related reactions.

passiveAbility.name: Fury of the Ancients
passiveAbility.description: After moving, deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage to an adjacent enemy and an additional enemy adjacent to the initial one. For 2 rounds, affected units cannot be revived, healed, repaired, nor otherwise restore Health. If Mephiston does not move, this ability triggers at the end of his turn.

characters.name: Morvenn Vahl
characters.description: Morvenn Vahl is the current Abbess Sanctorum of the Adepta Sororitas and a High Lord of Terra. She goes to battle in the Paragon Warsuit Purgator Mirabilis.

activeAbility.name: Sanctorum Missile
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage to a target within range [range] and [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage to all hexes adjacent to the target – with the exception of Morvenn Vahl's own hex, were she adjacent to the target.

passiveAbility.name: Righteous Repugnance
passiveAbility.description: Normal melee attacks deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to the target and to all enemy units adjacent to both the target and to Morvenn Vahl. When Morvenn Vahl defeats a unit with a melee attack, it has a [chance]% chance to count twice for Act of Faith.

characters.name: Nauseous Rotbone
characters.description: This accomplished Plague Surgeon is the personal physician of Mortarion himself. And he is the keeper of the surgical dungeons deep within the Black Manse, wherein the Death Guard keep their stocks of tainted gene-seed.

activeAbility.name: Revitalising Malignancy
activeAbility.description: Heals himself and all adjacent friendly units for [hpToHeal] Health, and an additional +[hpToHeal_2] Health to Chaos units. Imperial units do not receive any healing.

passiveAbility.name: Tainted Narthecium
passiveAbility.description: An adjacent friendly Chaos unit that is defeated has a [chance]% chance to be revived with [hp] Health, even if Overkilled. Can only be triggered once per turn.

characters.name: Neurothrope
characters.description: A Neurothrope’s physical form is given over to harnessing the power of the Hive Mind. Not only do they act as synapse nodes, but are a pulsing nexus of the Hive Mind's psychic might, channelling alien impulses into an eldritch onslaught.

activeAbility.name: Spirit Leech
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage to an enemy unit within [range] hexes. If the target is Suppressed, deals an additional +[extraDmg] Damage, otherwise Suppresses it. The Neurothrope heals itself and friendly Tyranids adjacent to it for Health equal to [hpToHealPct]% of the total damage dealt with this ability. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Neuroparasite
passiveAbility.description:
Each enemy that is dealt Psychic Damage by the Neurothrope is infected by a Neuroparasite until either the unit is healed or the Neurothrope is defeated. Whenever a unit infected with a Neuroparasite takes Psychic Damage or becomes affected by an attack or ability that would Suppress it, the level of the Neuroparasite increases by 1, up to a maximum of [buffMaxLevel].

Psychic Damage dealt by the Neurothrope is increased by +[extraDmg] Damage for each level of a Neuroparasite on the target.

characters.name: Nicodemus
characters.description: The Blood Angels’ Apothecaries hold responsibility for the Chapter’s soul as well as its body. Through their ministrations and ceremonies they call upon the Blood Angels to embrace the Red Thirst, control it and unleash their rage upon the enemy.

activeAbility.name: Blood Chalice
activeAbility.description: All adjacent friendly non-mechanical units are set to [healthPct]% Health. Until the start of their next turn, affected units gain +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio with melee attacks and heal for [hpToHeal] Health if they perform a melee attack.

passiveAbility.name: Sanguinary Priest
passiveAbility.description: After moving, all adjacent friendly non-mechanical units regenerate [hpToHeal]-[maxHpToHeal] Health. If Nicodemus does not move, this ability triggers at the end of his turn.

characters.name: Njal Stormcaller
characters.description: Known as the "Storm That Walks," Njal is the Space Wolves Chapter's High Rune Priest. Summoning ice-toothed blizzards to scatter his foes, he is an elemental focus of psychic fury.

activeAbility.name: Stormcaller
activeAbility.description: Target an enemy unit within [range] hexes. The target's hex and all adjacent hexes get covered in Ice. All enemies on hexes covered in Ice take [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage. Flying enemies damaged this way get Stunned for 1 round. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Lord Of Tempests
passiveAbility.description: Njal's normal attacks deal +[extraDmg] Damage for each hex surrounding him that is covered in Ice. The hex of each enemy that is hit by Njal's normal attacks is covered in Ice at the end of the attack.

characters.name: Olog Tanksmasha
characters.description: To compensate for a lifetime of perpetual concussion, nature has furnished smasha squigs with virtually no brain. Only the most belligerent Nobz can keep these beasts pointed forward long enough to make metal- and bone-pulverizing impacts.

activeAbility.name: Unstoppable Momentum
activeAbility.description:
Charges in one of 6 directions and keeps moving in a straight line until he hits an obstacle or a Big Target. Any enemies hit by the charge take [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage, increased by [extraDmg] Damage for each hex traversed from the starting hex to the enemy. Affected enemies get pushed and Suppressed for 1 round. A Big Target is Stunned for 1 round instead. Friendly units are also displaced, but take no damage or negative effects.

Initial cooldown: [initialCooldownTurns] round.

passiveAbility.name: Smasha 'Ead
passiveAbility.description: When he traverses 2 or more hexes during his turn, then Tanksmasha gains +[extraDmg] Damage for normal attacks and takes -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage until the start of his next turn.

characters.name: Overlord Anuphet
characters.description: Commanding legion upon legion of deathless soldiers whose only purpose is to obey his every order, Anuphet is a cold, calculating demigod.

activeAbility.name: Resurrection Orb
activeAbility.description:
In a free adjacent hex, summons 1 Necron Warrior for each round that has started. Summons 1 more Necron Warrior for each friendly unit with the trait Living Metal that was defeated in this battle.

Necron Warrior’s stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Martial Apotheosis
passiveAbility.description: At the start of its turn, Anuphet deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Energy Damage to a random adjacent enemy.

characters.name: Parasite of Mortrex
characters.description: Swooping on leathery wings, Parasites of Mortrex use their barbed ovipositors to drive Ripper gestation pods deep into their victims’ bodies. They wreak havoc on the foes of the Hive Fleet by soaring over defences and seeding unlucky souls with nascent Rippers.

activeAbility.name: It Itches!
activeAbility.description:
Suppresses and pushes an adjacent enemy unit and all enemy units adjacent to both the target and the Parasite of Mortrex one hex backwards. Enemy steppables on affected hexes are destroyed. Then summons a Ripper Swarm in each hex vacated by this ability. The Ripper Swarms can immediately attack. The Parasite of Mortrex may move again after activating this ability.

Ripper Swarm stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Barbed Ovipositor
passiveAbility.description:
When the Parasite of Mortrex defeats a unit it targeted that is not Mechanical it summons a Ripper Swarm in the defeated unit's hex. 

Ripper Swarm stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Pestillian Witherpus
characters.description: Biologus Putrifiers take obscene delight in developing myriad plagues and spreading them with blight grenades during battle. With their injector pistols they implant killing maladies into the enemy before extracting samples for their next experiment.

activeAbility.name: Foul Infusion
activeAbility.description: Pestillian and all friendly Chaos units within his Contagion aura deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [dmg] Toxic Damage with their normal melee attacks for this round and the next. Pestillian then immediately performs a normal melee attack against a random adjacent enemy.

passiveAbility.name: Explosive Maladies
passiveAbility.description: Friendly units adjacent to Pestillian deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [extraDmg] Blast Damage with their normal ranged attacks. Friendly Chaos units adjacent to Pestillian also deal this damage with normal melee attacks. Enemies defeated by affected attacks are always overkilled.

characters.name: Plasmancer Thutmose
characters.description: Plasmancers are unsubtle annihilators. They are capable of wielding energy as a weapon itself rather than needing to bind it to other forms.

activeAbility.name: Harbinger of Destruction
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage to a target and up to two other random enemies within [range] hexes. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Living Lightning
passiveAbility.description: After moving, deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage to one random adjacent enemy. If Thutmose does not move, then this ability triggers at the end of his turn. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

characters.name: Ragnar Blackmane
characters.description: Supremely confident and eager always to be first into the fray, Wolf Lord Ragnar Blackmane leads his Great Company in devastating planetary invasions. No longer as headstrong as in his youth, Ragnar's berserk rages are still furious hurricanes of violence.

activeAbility.name: War Howl
activeAbility.description: If Ragnar has not moved, he and all friendly Characters that don't have a normal ranged attack gain Unstoppable until the end of this turn. Additionally, their normal melee attacks have +[extraCritChance]% Crit Chance and deal +[extraDmg] Damage until the end of this turn. Using War Howl does not end Ragnar's turn.

passiveAbility.name: Saga of the Warrior Born
passiveAbility.description:
When charging, Ragnar scores [extraHits] additional hits and his critical hits deal an additional +[extraCritDmg] Crit Damage. 
If Ragnar has defeated one or more enemy Characters this battle, friendly Space Wolves also gain this ability.

characters.name: Roswitha Esther
characters.description: Canonesses are the martial and spiritual commanders of the Orders Militant. Each is a shining example of purity and dedication of purpose, a veteran warrior and a slayer of the faithless of many hundreds of battles.

activeAbility.name: Brazier of Holy Fire
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Flame Damage to a target enemy within range [range] and sets its hex on Fire. Deals [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Flame Damage vs Daemons instead. ALL Daemons within [range_2] hexes of the target take +[extraDmgPct]% Extra Damage this round and the next. Immune Daemons only take +[extraDmgPct_2]% Extra Damage.

passiveAbility.name: Condemnor Stake
passiveAbility.description: Deals +[extraDmg] Damage against Psykers.

characters.name: Royal Warden Makhotep
characters.description: Royal Wardens serve directly under an Overlord and ensure their lord’s will is carried out by the Dynasty’s armies. Royal Wardens can modify the orders to phalanxes of Necron Infantry, increasing their efficiency.

activeAbility.name: Adaptive Strategy
activeAbility.description: Triggers Relentless March again for all adjacent Non-Character friendly units and makes them immediately take an action, dealing [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Damage per hit if they attack.

passiveAbility.name: Relentless March
passiveAbility.description: Gives +1 Movement to all friendly units that start their turn in an adjacent hex. Also repairs affected Mechanical units for [hpToRepair] Health.

characters.name: Sarquael
characters.description: Bolt after bolt of plasma sears across the battlefield; those caught in the Hellblasters’ sights are swiftly annihilated, their armour blasted to ash and their flesh and bone to glowing motes.

activeAbility.name: Supercharge
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Plasma Damage to a target enemy within range [range] and [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Plasma Damage to up to two enemies in adjacent hexes behind the target, all with +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio. Until the beginning of Sarquael's next turn, any further hits that deal Plasma Damage against these units also have +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio.

passiveAbility.name: Grim Retribution
passiveAbility.description: During each enemy turn, if there is no enemy adjacent to Sarquael, he shoots back at the first enemy within range that attacked him or a friendly adjacent Dark Angel. This shot counts as Overwatch and deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Plasma Damage.

characters.name: Sergeant Bellator
characters.description: Equipped with jump packs and reinforced armour, Inceptors hit the enemy in one sudden and overwhelming blow, leaving them reeling as follow-up waves of Space Marines drive home the attack.

activeAbility.name: Death From Above
activeAbility.description: Summons 1 Inceptor for each round that has started. The Inceptors land adjacent to the target, whom they attack immediately. Note: if not enough hexes around the target are free, fewer Inceptors will be summoned. Inceptor stats: [summonHp] Health [summonDmg] Damage [summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Shock Assault
passiveAbility.description: Whenever Bellator attacks, any Inceptor adjacent to him also attacks eligible targets, dealing +[extraDmg] Damage for this attack.

characters.name: Sergeant Certus
characters.description: Dedicated marksmen, Eliminators haunt the shadows of the battlefield, seeking out targets of opportunity and bringing them down. Then, these silent assassins slip away looking for their next prey.

activeAbility.name: Mortis Round
activeAbility.description:
Deals 1x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Heavy Round Damage to a single target within range 3, which is then pushed back 1 hex.
The Heavy Weapon trait applies double to this ability.

passiveAbility.name: Camo Cloak
passiveAbility.description: Whenever an incoming ranged attack has its number of hits reduced for any reason, it deals -[dmgReduction] Damage per hit to this unit.

characters.name: Shas'el T'au Myamoto
characters.description: As much a maverick as he is a master of covert operations, Darkstrider is a formidable leader of stealth and sabotage missions. Despite often not following protocol, his expertise in guerilla warfare renders him an invaluable asset for the T'au.

activeAbility.name: Fighting Retreat
activeAbility.description: Adjacent enemies gain a Markerlight. They also have [hitsReduction] fewer hits, to a minimum of one, and deal -[dmgReduction] Damage for one round. Darkstrider and adjacent allied units ignore their Close Combat Weakness trait for ranged attacks until the end of this turn. Using Fighting Retreat does not end Darkstrider's turn if he is adjacent to an enemy, and he can move again if already moved in this turn.

passiveAbility.name: Structural Analyser
passiveAbility.description:
Units hit by ranged attacks from Darkstrider receive a Markerlight for one round.

Friendly units adjacent to Darkstrider deal +[extraDmg] Damage with ranged attacks against targets with a Markerlight. Friendly T'au Empire units within 2 hexes of Darkstrider are also affected.

characters.name: Shas'o T'au Shaserra
characters.description: An exceptional student of legendary commander Puretide, O'Shaserra excelled as a deadly warrior and brilliant commander. She is now the living spearhead and staunchest defender of the Greater Good and a shining example for the whole T'au empire.

activeAbility.name: Exemplar of the Kauyon
activeAbility.description:
Commander Shadowsun disappears, then reappears on a target hex adjacent to an allied unit and immediately performs a normal attack against the closest enemy target. This attack deals an additional [nrOfHits]x [dmg] Blast Damage. A stationary Command-Link Drone is summoned in the hex she previously occupied.

Initial cooldown: [initialCooldownTurns] round.

Command-Link Drone stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Defender of the Greater Good
passiveAbility.description: Friendly units adjacent to Shadowsun or her Command-Link Drone deal +[extraDmg] Damage with ranged attacks, except attacks that deal Psychic Damage. Affected attacks also have a chance to score an additional hit. This chance is [chance]% for each round in which Shadowsun has been on the battlefield. Friendly T'au Empire units within 2 hexes of Shadowsun or her Command-Link Drone are also affected by this ability.

characters.name: Shas'o Vior'la Shovah Kais Mont'yr
characters.description: Aggressive and rebellious, Commander O'Shovah is an undisputed master of Mont'ka, the T'au metastrategy of the Killing Blow. Piloting his crimson battlesuit, he leads his separatist Fire Caste forces from the front, carving a bloody path into the enemy.

activeAbility.name: Exemplar of the Mont'ka
activeAbility.description: Until the end of this turn, Commander Farsight and all other friendly Characters with a normal ranged attack gain Unstoppable and all their normal attacks deal +[extraDmg] Damage. When attacking a Big Target, they deal +[extraDmg_2] Damage instead. Using Exemplar of the Mont'ka does not end Commander Farsight's turn.

passiveAbility.name: Way of the Short Blade
passiveAbility.description:
Affects other friendly Characters within [range] hexes. Ranged attacks of affected units against enemies that are adjacent to a friendly Character have +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio and deal [dmgPct]% of their own damage to a maximum of [maxDmg] Damage per hit.

Commander Farsight and affected T'au Empire Characters that perform a melee attack immediately perform a normal ranged attack against the same unit, even if they are adjacent to it.

characters.name: Shas'ui Vior'la Sho'syl
characters.description: Hidden behind shimmering stealth fields, a Firesight Marksman transmits targeting data to the MV71 Sniper Drones in their thrall or, when deadly precision shots are not enough, calls in seeker missile strikes from artillery and air support.

activeAbility.name: Seeker Missile Frequency Lock
activeAbility.description: A target enemy unit within [range] receives a Markerlight until the end of Sho'syl's next turn. At the beginning of Sho'syl's next turn, if he is still in play, the target is hit by a Seeker Missile dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Heavy Round Damage. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: MV71 Sniper Drone Squad
passiveAbility.description:
Instead of a ranged attack, Sho'syl summons a MV71 Sniper Drone and commands it to attack the target. This attack uses Sho'syl's Damage stat, while other effects, like buffs, are taken from the Drone. If Sho'syl already controls [maxSummons] MV71 Sniper Drones, the one with the lowest Health is removed before the new Drone is summoned.
The target also gains a Markerlight until the end of Sho'syl's next turn.

MV71 Sniper Drones' stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Shas'vre Vior'la Re'vas
