characters.description: Piloted by courageous Fire Caste veterans, XV8 Crisis Battlesuits are as tough and well armed as other races light tanks, yet they also boast jet-assisted speed to strike swiftly wherever the battle rages most fiercely.

activeAbility.name: Early Warning Override
activeAbility.description:
Summons 2 Shield Drones into free adjacent hexes. Newly summoned Shield Drones can immediately attack an enemy in melee, but cannot move this turn.
Re'vas also starts Overwatching until the start of her next turn, ignoring the Close Combat Weakness trait and dealing +[extraDmg] Damage. When defeating a unit while Overwatching, she remains in Overwatch, retaining [hitsReduction] fewer hits compared to the previous attack. 

Shield Drones' stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Cyclic Ion Blaster
passiveAbility.description:
All attacks deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Particle Damage.
If the target has a Markerlight or the Mechanical trait these hits deal +[extraDmg] Damage.

characters.name: Shiron Capersi, the Idolator
characters.description: Noise Marines saturate the war zone with extreme psychosonic attacks that unleash shattering noise and aural destruction. These hedonistic worshippers of Slaanesh are inured to most stimuli and seek to unleash the most cacophonous riots to stir their jaded senses.

activeAbility.name: Excruciating Frequencies
activeAbility.description: Affects [nrOfTiles] hexes in a straight line in one of 6 directions. This attack has +[extraCritChance]% Crit Chance for each unit on affected hexes and deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage to each enemy on affected hexes. Enemies hit are also Suppressed.

passiveAbility.name: Terrifying Crescendo
passiveAbility.description: Shiron's ranged attacks deal +[extraDmg] Damage for each time he Overkilled or would have Suppressed an enemy unit, up to a maximum of [buffMaxLevel] times.

characters.name: Sibyll Devine
characters.description: Primaris Psykers are rare and extraordinary individuals who wield the destructive power of the warp as a weapon to smite the enemies of the Emperor, their every action a walk on a fine line between heroic service and eternal damnation.

activeAbility.name: Psychic Maelstrom
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage to a target within [range] hexes. [chance]% chance to score another hit. If it does, [chance_2]% chance to score another hit. If it does, [chance_3]% chance to score another hit. If it does, [chance_4]% chance to score another hit. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Nightshroud
passiveAbility.description: All friendly units starting their turn adjacent to Sibyll Devine gain Infiltrate for that turn and take -[dmgReduction] Damage from each hit in their and the next enemy turn.

characters.name: Snappawrecka
characters.description: Surgically wiring grots into combat walkers is risky: the runty loons tend to go on a bit of a power trip, hazardous to every Ork that ever treated them badly. It is, however, also hazardous to every enemy in the way.

activeAbility.name: Dakka! Dakka! Dakka!
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Projectile Damage to an enemy within range [range]. Adds +[extraHits] hits for each time Snappawrecka was repaired this battle, but cannot exceed [maxNrOfHits] hits in total. If the target is defeated, leftover hits are allocated to random enemies within [range_2] hexes. Snappawrecka also loses [healthPct]% of his maximum Health.

passiveAbility.name: Power Trip
passiveAbility.description: Normal attacks ignore [armorIgnored] Armour. If Snappawrecka is at full Health, his normal attacks additionally score +[extraHit] hit and reduce the target's Armour by [armorReduction] Armour, but also cause Snappawrecka to lose [hpPct]% of his maximum Health.

characters.name: Sokar Toth
characters.description: Undead husks of dust controlled by their Sorcerer masters, the Scarab Occult Terminators advance upon their foes implacably and as silent as the grave, still fighting with all the merciless skill they had when they were Magnus’ elite bodyguards.

activeAbility.name: Hellfyre Missile Rack
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Heavy Round Damage to a target enemy unit within range [range] and an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Heavy Round Damage to each enemy unit on the map that was dealt Psychic Damage this turn, which can include the initial target again. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Time Flux
passiveAbility.description:
At the beginning of his turn, Toth regenerates [hpToHeal] Health plus an additional amount equal to the Damage of the last hit he received in the last enemy turn. The total amount restored cannot exceed [maxHpToHeal] Health.

When Toth moves, he leaves a time ghost behind on the hex he moved from. The time ghost vanishes if the hex becomes occupied by another unit or if the terrain becomes impassable (as with Broken Ice). The first time Toth dies each battle, if his time ghost is on the battlefield then he revives with [hp] Health remaining at its location. This works even if Toth is Overkilled.

characters.name: Sword Brother Fedreus Godswyl
characters.description: An unstoppable, uncompromising and reaping whirlwind on the battlefield, every Sword Brother has earned their place amongst the Marshal’s household through acts of unswerving faith and spectacular violence.

activeAbility.name: Thunderous Assault
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to an adjacent enemy and pushes it one hex backwards. The target is Stunned for 1 round. Sword Brother Godswyl then moves into the vacated hex if able. Enemies defeated by this attack are always overkilled.

passiveAbility.name: Champion Of The Feast
passiveAbility.description: After moving, deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to an adjacent enemy and reduces this enemy's Armour by [armorReduction] Armour for the rest of the battle. If Sword Brother Godswyl does not move, then this ability triggers at the end of his turn.

characters.name: Sy-gex-KPH008/15.mk41
characters.description: These biomechanical constructs operate as mobile heavy weapons platforms, bearing large esoteric cannons. Their ballistic subroutines can be directed to operate independently of preprogrammed battle protocols, making them flexible tools of destruction.

activeAbility.name: Sentinel Directives
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Physical Damage to an enemy unit within range [range] and Suppresses it for 1 round. Cannot be used if there is an enemy adjacent to Sy-Gex. Using Sentinel Directives does not end Sy-Gex's turn and he can still enter Overwatch this turn, unless he performs a normal attack.

passiveAbility.name: Heavy Grav-Cannon
passiveAbility.description: Ranged attacks against MK X Gravis, Terminator Armour or Mechanical units deal +[extraDmg] Damage and have +[extraPierceRatio]% pierce ratio.

characters.name: Tan Gi'da
characters.description: Privileged to enhanced augmentations, Marshals are veteran warriors that stand as intermediaries between the Skitarii and their priestly masters, employing sacred uplinks to refine their warriors’ doctrines closer to holy perfection and lead the Skitarii to ensured victory.

activeAbility.name: Doctrina Imperatives
activeAbility.description: Tan Gi’da switches between two Imperatives that affect him and all friendly adjacent Mechanical units: Protector Imperative: Affected units have +[extraArmor] Armour. Conqueror Imperative: Affected units deal +[extraDmg] Damage against units with reduced Armour. This ability can be used once per turn instead of once per battle; each use switches the active Imperative. Tan Gi’da can attack after using this ability. Only the first use of this ability each battle counts for missions.

passiveAbility.name: Control Edict
passiveAbility.description:
While Protector Imperative is active: After Tan Gi’da attacks, summon a Skitarii Vanguard in a free adjacent hex. Cannot have more than [maxSummons] Skitarii Vanguards summoned this way at the same time.

While Conqueror Imperative is active: After Tan Gi’da attacks, all friendly adjacent Mechanical Summons also immediately attack his target if it is within range.

Skitarii Vanguard stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Tarvakh, the Headsman
characters.description: Masters of Executions are the enforcers and headhunters of Chaos warbands. These single-minded axemen stride unflinchingly towards the enemy's greatest champions and most beloved leaders, bellowing a fatal decree before crashing forward and claiming their skulls.

activeAbility.name: Murderous Swing
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage to all adjacent enemies. If this attack only hits one enemy, it deals +[extraDmg] Damage.

passiveAbility.name: Trophy Taker
passiveAbility.description: Tarvakh's attacks against units that are at or below [hpPct]% of their maximum Health deal+[extraDmg] Damage and an additional +[extraCritDmg] Crit Damage. His Crit chance is increased by [extraCritChance]% for each unit that he defeated this battle.

characters.name: Thaddeus Noble
characters.description: Masters of Ordnance are the eyes on the battlefield, spotting for batteries of long-range weaponry nested far from the front lines. Wherever they direct their gaze, a rain of exploding shells is sure to follow.

activeAbility.name: Basilisk Barrage
activeAbility.description: If Thaddeus Noble has not moved, unleashes a barrage of [nrOfProjectiles] shells on any target on the battlefield, each dealing [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Blast Damage. [nrOfProjectiles_2] randomly hit the target hex or surrounding hexes and the remaining 2 hit the hexes surrounding those. For each round that has ended, 1 more of the shells hits the target hex, starting with the shells hitting the outer hexes. The Suppressive Fire trait applies also to this ability. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Spotter
passiveAbility.description: Other friendly units within [range] hexes deal +[extraDmg] Damage with ranged attacks. Affected units with Heavy Weapon deal +[extraDmg_2] Damage with ranged attacks instead.

characters.name: The Patermine
characters.description: Psychic abomination; alpha predator; parasitic demigod – the Patriarch is all of these things and worse. Prowling the shadows of embattled worlds, they are the source of the bio corruption that spawns each Genestealer Cult cell.

activeAbility.name: Might From Below
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage to an adjacent enemy, then summons a Purestrain Genestealer on each decoy adjacent to the Patermine. The Purestrain Genestealers can immediately attack in melee, but cannot move this turn. Purestrain Genestealer stats: [summonHp] Health [summonDmg] Damage [summonArmor] Armour This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Cosmic Horror
passiveAbility.description: Whenever the Patermine defeats an enemy, it places a decoy on the hex of that enemy. Other enemies surrounding the defeated unit have a [chance]% chance to be Suppressed for 1 round, and have a [chance]% chance to trigger Battle Fatigue a second time, if they have it. When the Patermine moves onto a decoy, it heals itself for [hp] Health.

characters.name: Tjark Wyrdslayer
characters.description: Daubed with runes of warding and abjuration, Hounds of Morkai are obsessed hunters of psykers. Runic circuitry augments their uniquely pitched hunting call, disrupting their prey’s powers and sowing fear before the kill.

activeAbility.name: Grapnel Launcher
activeAbility.description: Targets an enemy unit within [range] hexes and deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Physical Damage to it. If Tjark is not already adjacent to the target, it is then pulled 1 hex towards Tjark if possible, and can be pulled over any elevation but not through impassable terrain. Tjark then moves to occupy the hex the target originally occupied if it's free, or a free adjacent hex if it is not. If there are no free hexes, then Tjark does not move.

passiveAbility.name: Hunters Beyond Death
passiveAbility.description:
Deals +[extraDmg] Damage against Psykers, and enemy Psykers within 2 hexes deal -[dmgReduction] Damage.

Unless they are Immune, Enemy Psykers within 2 hexes will not hit an additional unit with their normal ranged attacks.

characters.name: Trajann Valoris
characters.description: Many claim that Trajann Valoris is the greatest warrior to have ever held the title of Captain-General, one of the most powerful military appointments in the Imperium. Valoris is responsible for the overall defence of the Sol System, Terra, and the Emperor himself.

activeAbility.name: Moment Shackle
activeAbility.description: Trajann heals himself for [hpToHeal] Health. For [nrOfRounds] round, Trajann has +[blockChance]% Block chance and blocks an additional +[blockDmg] Damage. During that round, he also deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Bolter Damage to each enemy unit that moves from a hex adjacent to him.

passiveAbility.name: Legendary Commander
passiveAbility.description: Enemies receive +[extraDmg] Damage if they are adjacent to any friendly unit that has used an active ability this turn. If the affected enemies are also adjacent to Trajann, friendly Characters score [nrOfHits] additional hits against them with their first attack that is not a normal attack.

characters.name: Typhus, Host of the Destroyer Hive
characters.description: Once first Captain of the Death Guard, Calas Typhon led his whole legion into the rotten embrace of the God of Plagues. Now he is Typhus, the Herald of Nurgle, spreading his god’s devastating gifts throughout the galaxy.

activeAbility.name: Plague Wind
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x[minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage to a target within [range] hexes. Any enemies adjacent to the initial target take [nrOfHits]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Psychic Damage. Any further enemies adjacent to at least one secondary target take [nrOfHits]x [minDmg_3]-[maxDmg_3] Psychic Damage. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Destroyer Hive
passiveAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Direct Damage to one random adjacent enemy at the start of his turn.

characters.name: Tyrant Guard
characters.description: Tyrant Guards are the ultimate bodyguards, the entire purpose of their creation being to protect their Hive Tyrant. They take the form of colossal living shields, all but impervious to even the heaviest weapons.

activeAbility.name: Crushing Claws
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage to an adjacent enemy and Taunts them for 1 round. Enemies adjacent to both the Tyrant Guard and the target take [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Physical Damage and then get pushed back 1 hex. All affected units become Suppressed for 1 round.

passiveAbility.name: Guardian Organism
passiveAbility.description: If the Tyrant Guard is within Synapse range or did not move during its previous turn, it and friendly units affected by its Big Target trait take -[dmgReductionPct]% Damage during the enemy's next turn, up to a maximum of -[dmgReduction] Damage per hit.

characters.name: Tyrith Shiva Kyrus
characters.description: Tyrith sees enacting the Emperor’s Will as her utmost duty. She was an advocate for expanding the reach of the Custodians beyond the halls of the Imperial Palace to guard against any risk to the Throne, even condemning worlds to Exterminatus in order to divert threats from Terra.

activeAbility.name: Vigilance Eternal
activeAbility.description: Targets an enemy unit that has a free adjacent hex within movement range [range] of Tyrith or is already on a hex adjacent to Tyrith. She then moves to the free hex and deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to the targeted unit. This ability can be used multiple times per battle but has a cooldown of [cooldownTurns] rounds. Using Vigilance Eternal does not end Tyrith's turn.

passiveAbility.name: Unwavering Sentinel
passiveAbility.description: During each enemy turn, after Tyrith is attacked and the attacker is within range [range], she deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Bolter Damage to the attacker. If there is an enemy adjacent to Tyrith, the range of this ability is reduced to 1.

characters.name: Ulf Frosthowl
characters.description: Altered by the Curse lying in the blood of all scions of the Wolf King, Wulfen exist on the brink of constant berserk rages. They are bestial warriors and savage hunters, ripping foes apart with inhuman speed.

activeAbility.name: Great Frost Axe
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Piercing Damage to an adjacent enemy and covers the hex the enemy stands on and all hexes adjacent to it in Ice. The Crit Damage bonus of the Ice is already applied for this attack.

passiveAbility.name: Savage Killer
passiveAbility.description: When a Summon moves to or is summoned adjacent to Ulf, he immediately deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Power Damage to it. Ulf will also perform this ability against any enemy that attempts to use an active ability while in a hex adjacent to him, in which case he deals his Damage before that unit's ability is activated.

characters.name: Varro Tigurius
characters.description: Tigurius is the Ultramarines Chief Librarian and as such is one of the most powerful psykers in the Imperium. Since crossing the Rubicon Primaris he can push his abilities even further.

activeAbility.name: Storm Of Wrath
activeAbility.description: Deals 1x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage to a unit within 2 hexes and up to [maxAdjacentTargets] adjacent units. This ability's Damage ignores all of the attacker bonuses and modifiers (including elevation), and cannot Crit.

passiveAbility.name: Psychic Fortress
passiveAbility.description: All friendly surrounding units have an added Block with [blockChance]% chance to block [blockDmg] Damage. Also reduces incoming Psychic Damage by [dmgReduction].

characters.name: Volk, Reforged by the Warp
characters.description: Some believe Obliterators are the by-product of a heretical quest to embody the Omnissiah, whilst others think they are infected with a daemonic technovirus. Whatever creates them, they are a blasphemy against nature and Machine God alike.

activeAbility.name: Frenzied Firing
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Heavy Round Damage to a target enemy in range [range] and to all enemies adjacent to it. Scores an additional hit to the target for each free hex adjacent to it, up to a maximum of [maxNrOfHits] hits. Additional hits from Fleshmetal Guns are scored against each enemy attacked.

passiveAbility.name: Fleshmetal Guns
passiveAbility.description:
At the start of his turn, Volk gains one of three effects until the start of his next turn. The effects are granted one after the other, repeating every three turns.

Volk's ranged attacks score additional hits, based on the current effect:
Focused Malice: [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Melta Damage
Ruinous Salvo: [nrOfHits_2]x [minDmg_2]-[maxDmg_2] Flame Damage
Warp Hail: [nrOfHits_3]x [minDmg_3]-[maxDmg_3] Heavy Round Damage, and these hits add Despoiled Ground to the hexes of attacked units.

characters.name: Winged Tyranid Prime
characters.description: The Winged Tyranid Prime is the apex of the Tyranid Warrior strain. Boasting powerful wings and a greater synaptic capacity than their lesser kindred, these alpha Warriors command the swarming tide of chitinous horrors that signals a Hive Fleet's arrival.

activeAbility.name: Alpha Warrior
activeAbility.description:
If the Winged Prime has not moved this turn, summons a Tyranid Warrior on a free hex within Synapse range. The Tyranid Warrior cannot move this turn, but can immediately perform a normal attack against an enemy in range.

Tyranid Warrior stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

passiveAbility.name: Synaptic Linchpin
passiveAbility.description:
Whenever the Winged Prime, or another friendly unit with Synapse, performs a normal attack against an enemy and that enemy is not defeated, summons a Hormagaunt adjacent to the target, which immediately attacks the enemy. Cannot have more than [maxSummons] Hormagaunts summoned this way at the same time.

Hormagaunt stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Wrask, the Butcher
characters.description: Clad in – or fused to – ancient suits of corrupted war-plate, Chaos Terminators are murderous elites akin to walking tanks. Wading through futile volleys of enemy fire, they tear apart squads and vehicles alike at the head of their warband.

activeAbility.name: Bloody Fury
activeAbility.description: Deals [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Chain Damage to an adjacent enemy. This attack scores +[extraHit] hit for each time Wrask was attacked in this battle, to a maximum of [maxNrOfHits] hits total. Any leftover hits are allocated to remaining adjacent enemies, prioritising kills.

passiveAbility.name: Wrathful Devotion
passiveAbility.description: When Wrask arrives from Deep Strike or defeats an enemy in melee, he and adjacent friendly Chaos units gain a Shield with [shieldHp] Health for 1 round.

characters.name: Xybia Kheiser
characters.description: The Magus acts as its Patriarch’s vizier, and as the head of that alien monstrosity’s deviant church. Each one is a powerful psyker, their formidable will enhanced by the gestalt powers of the Star Children until they can manipulate enemies’ minds and bodies like puppets.

activeAbility.name: Mind Control
activeAbility.description: Targets an enemy unit within [range] hexes that is adjacent to one or more friendly units. For this round and the next, that enemy unit deals -[dmgReduction] Damage, takes +[extraDmgPct]% Damage, and becomes Taunted by the adjacent unit with the highest current Health.

passiveAbility.name: Spiritual Leader
passiveAbility.description:
After moving, places a decoy on an empty adjacent hex. Then, if there are 2 or more decoys adjacent to Xybia, summons a Neophyte Hybrid on one adjacent decoy. If Xybia does not move, then this ability triggers at the end of her turn.

Neophyte Hybrid stats:
[summonHp] Health
[summonDmg] Damage
[summonArmor] Armour

characters.name: Yazaghor Ficklefate
characters.description: Most blessed of all their kind, the Enlightened see the skeins of fate through communion with Tzeentch. They surge to battle atop daemonic discs, their Fatecaster Greatbows launching ensorcelled arrows from ectoplasmic strings with lethal effect.

activeAbility.name: Sorcerous Facade
activeAbility.description: Target a friendly Psyker. Until the beginning of Yazaghor's next turn both he and the target deal an additional [nrOfHits]x [minDmg]-[maxDmg] Psychic Damage with their normal attacks. Yazaghor performs a normal attack against the closest enemy unit, and then switches positions with the targeted Psyker. Note: this ability can only be used if Yazaghor has an enemy in range.

passiveAbility.name: Reality Unbound
passiveAbility.description: For each different enemy unit that was dealt Psychic Damage this turn Yazaghor deals +[extraMaxDmg] Maximum Damage with his normal ranged attacks. If three or more different enemy units have been dealt Psychic Damage this turn he gains +[extraMovement] Movement and his normal ranged attack gets +[extraRange] Range until the end of this turn.
